alert.note: Alert for Greene; Oconee; Oglethorpe (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 12:58PM EST until January 13 at 4:42AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Penfield affecting Oconee, Oglethorpe and Greene Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding will continue. * WHERE...Oconee River near Penfield. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 17 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand into fields...woodlands and pastures near the river. The water level is very close to Ward Road on the right bank. Flood waters will be approaching irrigation systems and they may need to be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 17.0 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 PM EST Friday was 19.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 7.4 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 13 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. late tonight at 100 AM EST.
